summary: This bill, the Measuring Adverse Market Disruption And National Impact Act (MAMDANI Act), directs the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to study the potential impacts of public grocery stores. The study will analyze the competitive effects on private grocery stores, farmers, food banks, and food supply chains. It will also examine consumer access, prices, subsidies, agricultural impacts, long-term market affects, and potential unfair competition. The FTC is required to use existing data and report findings and recommendations to Congress annually.
